item.title: Anna add a quote by Stephen Crane
Anna add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "There is neither happiness nor misery in the world; there is only the comparison of one state with another, nothing more. He who has felt the deepest grief is best able to experience supreme happiness. We must have felt what it is to die, Morrel, that we may appreciate the enjoyments of life. " Live, then, and be happy, beloved children of my heart, and never forget, that until the day God will deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is contained in these two words, 'Wait and Hope." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Anna add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "Never fear quarrels, but seek hazardous adventures." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Anna add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Being a woman is a terribly difficult task, since it consists principally in dealing with men." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Anna add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Anna add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Peace begins with a smile.." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Anna add a quote by Stanislaw Lem
item.description: "Good books tell the truth, even when they're about things that never have been and never will be. They're truthful in a different way" -- Stanislaw Lem

item.title: Anna add a quote by Jonathan Swift
item.description: "Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed." -- Jonathan Swift

item.title: Anna add a quote by Stendhal
item.description: "A good book is an event in my life." -- Stendhal

item.title: Anna add a quote by David Wolfe
item.description: "When you are attracted to, and eat, fruits, occasionally a seed will be carried within you to a fertile ground." -- David Wolfe

item.title: Anna add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "It's kind of fun to do the impossible." -- Walt Disney
